Title: 15% Import Duty: Balancing consumer relief with national energy security
Summary: The suspension of the planned 15 per cent import duty on petroleum products may calm public anxiety, but the decision exposes a troubling problem . Balancing consumer relief with national energy security with national security security .

Title: Udom Emmanuel rallies support for Tinubu ahead of 2027
Summary: Udom Emmanuel called on Nigerians to ignore all biases and massively support President Bola Tinubu . Emmanuel stated this at an interactive session at an event in Abu Dhabi .

Title: Fresh abductions, killings test Tinubu’s security emergency, heighten anxiety
Summary: Fresh abductions, killings and coordinated raids across multiple states heighten anxiety . President Bola Tinubu’s security emergency has intensified pressure on him .

Title: ‘How Nigeria can become AI hub for Africa’
Summary: Founder/Chief Executive Officer of pan-African digital infrastructure company, Kasi Cloud, Johnson Agogbua, has tasked the Nigerian government with creating an AI hub for Africa .

Title: Nigeria to face Cote d’Ivoire, Benin Republic in Group B
Summary: Nigeria has been pitted against Benin Republic and Cote d’Ivoire in the group stage of the WAFU B zonal qualifiers for this year’s CAF

Title: Stock market: Investors lose N6.544 trn in November amid tax concern, interest rate
Summary: Selloffs of shares dominated the Nigerian Exchange Limited, NGX, as investors lost over N6.544 trillion . Concerns on Capital Gain Tax, CGT, and interest rate among other macroeconomic factors . Title: Manufacturers kick as Senate mulls duty hike on sugar products
Summary: Manufacturers under the aegis of the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN) have kicked against a proposal to increase excise duty on carbonated sugar-sweetened beverages . Stakeholders expressed divergent views at a public hearing jointly organised by the Senate Committees on Finance and Customs .

Title: Canadian Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, December 1, 2025
Summary: The Canadian dollar traded at roughly ₦1,030 to � 1,040 against the Nigerian naira on Monday, December 1 . The exchange rate reflects latest mid-market and black-market currency conversions observed online .

Title: Manufacturing sector tops VAT contribution at 26.6% in H1’25
Summary: Manufacturing sector remained the top-contributing sector to Nigeria’s Value-added Tax (VAT) Collections in the first half of 2025 (H1’25), with a contribution of N584.63 billion, representing 26.6 percent of the total local VAT collections of N2.197 trillion within the period

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, December 1, 2025
Summary: The dollar traded higher against the naira on Monday, December 1, 2025, as year-end demand for foreign currency nudged parallel market prices up . Official Nigerian Foreign Exchange Market rate remained steadier .

Title: Court orders N1.07bn payment to ex-Kogi deputy gov
Summary: The National Industrial Court in Abuja has ordered United Bank for Africa Plc to pay a total of N1.07bn to former Kogi State Deputy Governor, Simon Achuba . The total sum is to be paid directly into Achuba’s Access Bank account . UBA had argued that the money was sourced from the World

Title: Suspected cultists kill policeman, passerby in Ogun
Summary: A suspected cult clash in the Ilese area of Ijebu-Ode, Ogun State, has left a police officer and one yet-to-be-identified man dead . The attack occurred on Saturday night when suspected cultists stormed the area and began shooting sporadically . The source said the attackers killed a

Title: India arrests Nigerian over drug supply to 1,975 buyers
Summary: A Nigerian suspect has been arrested in India for allegedly supplying about N812m (Rs 5 crore) worth of drugs to no fewer than 1,975 consumers in Telangana . Title: Nigerian coach sells Osimhen’s boots
Summary: Olisa Ezeasor has sold the pair of boots gifted to him by Super Eagles striker Victor Osimhen . Assistant coach of Solution FC – an Anambra-based Nigeria National League side – put the boots up for sale at N1m . Title: Australia’s December 10 under-16 social media ban sparks debate
Summary: Australia's under-16 social media ban will make the nation a real-life laboratory on how best to tackle the technology’s impact on young people, experts say .
